Name: readlink
Warning: This accepts filename arguments; if an attacker can move those files or change the link content, a race condition results.  Also, it does not terminate with ASCII NUL. (CWE-362, CWE-20)
Suggestion: Reconsider approach

Name: sscanf
Warning: The scanf() family's %s operation, without a limit specification, permits buffer overflows (CWE-120, CWE-20)
Suggestion: Specify a limit to %s, or use a different input function
Note: If the scanf format is influenceable by an attacker, it's exploitable.

Name: vfprintf
Warning: If format strings can be influenced by an attacker, they can be exploited (CWE-134)
Suggestion: Use a constant for the format specification

Name: access
Warning: This usually indicates a security flaw.  If an attacker can change anything along the path between the call to access() and the file's actual use (e.g., by moving files), the attacker can exploit the race condition (CWE-362/CWE-367!)
Suggestion: Set up the correct permissions (e.g., using setuid()) and try to open the file directly
